page.title: 14Grantham: Army Cadet Force
page.content: The Colsterworth Detachment of the 17th/21st Lancers,Army Cadet Force, meet weekly at 7pm at the Guard Room of Prince William Barracks.After roll call they drill for 15 minutes and then have instruction in map and compass, skill at arms, fieldcraft, first aid and Army organisation.At 8.15 there is a N.A.A.F.I. break for refreshments.After a further 45 minutes instruction the session ends with a parade when future plans are announced. The uniform consists of a jumper,two shirts,puttees,three pairs of trousers,a beret,a camouflage jacket,a cap comforter,a work belt and the famous scull and crossbones motto or cap badge of the 17th/21st Lancers,a Regular Army tank regiment stationed at Munster in Germany.
